column3:
I think this is a good idea.
utACK.

Miner and Wallet init help strings could also slowly migrate into wallet/ miner/ classes. I once did this for the wallet, but it requires rebase and maybe more small, reviewable PRs: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/5990
Why this changes from -1 to `GetArg("-genproclimit", DEFAULT_GENERATE_THREADS)` but in `getmininginfo()` the change is from -1 to DEFAULT_GENERATE_THREADS?\n
You still want to obey the command line arg if nothing is set via rpc.\n
hmm... is "default" the correct context here? Because it's no longer the default value if you have provided a different value over the command line argument. Maybe `current default value`?\n
Is it a bugfix or enhanced functionality? Again, why one uses GetArg() but the other doesn't?\n
The default value means "the default value unless you set it via command line argument".\n
Yes, it fixes one bug:  If genproclimit is omitted to RPC setgenerate, don't change it; (copied from commit msg)\n

Making `getmininginfo` push back the "correct" value `nGenProcLimit` may involve some more work. But at least this PR did not introduce the issue. The PR is not perfect, but improves things considerably.\n
Thank you. Everything else was completely trivial to review, but I thought this deserved a more detailed explanation.\n
"default" means whatever you get if you don't provide it.\n
Good find on missing ENABLE_WALLET here\n
